208.description: The boiler is in chimney sweep or service operation.

200.description: The boiler is in central heating mode.

201.description: The boiler is in hot water mode.

202.description: The boiler is waiting. There has been a heat demand from an on/off or a ModuLine control more than once every 10 minutes.

305.description: The boiler waits after the hot water operation has ended.

353.description: The boiler is waiting. The boiler has never been off for more than 20 minutes in 24 hours.

283.description: The boiler is preparing for a burner start. The fan and the pump are controlled.

265.description: The boiler is waiting. The boiler regularly switches on at low load to meet the heat demand.

284.description: The gas control block is activated.

205.description: The boiler is waiting for the air pressure switch to switch.

204.description: The boiler is waiting. The measured supply temperature is higher than the calculated or set heating water temperature.

276.description: The flow temperature sensor has measured a temperature higher than 95 ºC.

277.description: The safety temperature sensor has measured a temperature higher than 95 ºC.

285.description: The return temperature sensor has measured a temperature greater than 95ºC.

359.description: The hot water temperature sensor has measured a temperature that is too high.

316.description: The flue gas temperature sensor has measured a temperature that is too high.

210.description: The flue gas thermostat has measured too high a temperature and is open.

346.description: The temperature of the flue gas temperature sensor is rising too fast.

317.description: The flue gas temperature sensor contacts are short-circuited.

318.description: The flue gas temperature sensor contacts are open.

343.description: During central heating operation: the flue gas temperature sensor measures a temperature increase, but the flow temperature sensor does not.

344.description: During hot water operation: The flue gas temperature sensor measures a temperature increase, but the flow temperature sensor does not.

348.description: During hot water operation: the flow temperature is higher than 85 ºC.

207.description: The central heating water pressure is too low.

260.description: The flow temperature sensor does not measure a temperature rise after a burner start.

271.description: The measured temperature difference between the flow and safety temperature sensor is too great.

338.description: Burner start aborted too many times.

345.description: The flow temperature sensor does not measure a temperature rise after a burner start.

329.description: The pressure sensor is not measuring water flow.

212.description: The temperature measured by the flow temperature sensor or the safety temperature sensor is rising too fast.

341.description: The temperature measured by the flow temperature sensor or the return temperature sensor is rising too fast.

342.description: The temperature measured by the flow temperature sensor rises too quickly.

213.description: The measured temperature between the flow and return temperature sensors is too great.

349.description: The temperature difference measured at low load between the flow temperature sensor and the return temperature sensor is too great.

281.description: The pump is stuck or spinning in air.

282.description: The pump control signal is missing.

264.description: The control signal or the voltage of the fan has been lost during operation.

217.description: The fan speed is erratic during startup.

273.description: The boiler has been switched off for a maximum of 2 minutes because the boiler has been in continuous operation for 24 hours. This is a safety check.

214.description: Fan does not run during the startup phase (0C).

216.description: The fan speed is too low.

215.description: The fan speed is too high.

218.description: The flow temperature sensor has measured a temperature higher than 105 ºC.

332.description: The flow temperature sensor has measured a temperature higher than 110 ºC.

224.description: A appliance thermostat (eg maximum or burner thermostat) has measured a temperature that is too high and is open.

225.description: An unexpectedly large temperature difference was measured in the dual sensor.

347.description: The return temperature sensor has measured a higher heating water temperature than the supply temperature sensor. A restart follows after 10 minutes.

375.description: The contacts of the external sensor (eg solar sensor) are short-circuited.

376.description: The contacts of the external sensor (eg solar sensor) are interrupted.

219.description: The safety temperature sensor has measured a temperature higher than 105 C.

220.description: The contacts of the safety temperature sensor are short-circuited or the safety temperature sensor has measured a temperature higher than 130 ºC.

221.description: The contacts of the safety temperature sensor are open.
